div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1142 Kerch, (anc. Panticapaeum), Crimea (558) oblast, Ukraine, 1910 Burial: before 80 B.C. (Golenko) Contents: 195+ AE. From harbor Panticapaeum: 120 AE (as BMC 34 [4], 35 [111]; Minns, pl. 5, 24 [5]) Gorgippia: 26 AE (as Minns, pl. 9, 24 [23]; types of BMC Panticapaeum 34 [3]) Phanagoria: 11 AE (as BMC 7) Sinope: 1 AE (as RGA I.1, pl. 26, 21) Unc.: 37 AE Disposition: Leningrad (a part only, merged with main coll.); museum material lost during war (a further part) â€ DAK, report of V. V. Shkorpil, no. 77, of May 24, 1910 Zograph, Ol'viia 1940, p. 296 Golenko, Klio 46 (1965), p. 320
